Can Sharjeel, Umar speeches be deemed terror acts: Supreme Court to cops
description: The Supreme Court questioned Delhi Police on invoking stringent UAPA provisions against riot accused for speeches, seeking justification for linking terror acts to their words.  Justices sought clarity on how Section 15, pertaining to terrorist acts, applies when arms weren't directly used by the accused, who have been jailed for over five years.

description: ‘Captive breeding emerged as a tool of insurance against major declines. But it was always meant to complement, not replace, habitat protection. Unfortunately, much emphasis and resources were laid on protecting and breeding tragopans from outside the wild while conserving species in their natural habitats was undermined’

description: The United States has seized a large oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela, President Trump announced, marking a significant escalation in pressure on Nicolás Maduro's regime. The tanker, involved in transporting sanctioned oil from Venezuela and Iran, was targeted by a seizure warrant executed by federal agencies.

title: 'Dhurandhar' Day 6: Ranveer, Akshaye, R Madhavan starrer nears Rs 200 crore mark
description: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' is making waves at the box office, surpassing previous releases within its first six days. The action-drama is on track to hit the Rs 200 crore milestone, with strong weekday collections indicating its continued success. The film is also garnering positive reviews, with Ranvir Shorey praising it as a 'kicka** spy thriller'.

description: Work to install lamp posts and to lay power lines has already begun near the VHS hospital, said a source in the Highways Department

title: Chennai airport faces minor dip in revenue after IndiGo fiasco
description: A total of 629 flights of IndiGo were cancelled between December 1 and 9 at the Chennai airport and a total of 1,317 flights were delayed, according to the data released by AAI

description: The authors conducted a descriptive cross-sectional study using secondary programme data from 15 administrative zones of Chennai district

'Want to play T20 World Cup': Jaiswal opens up amid Gill’s poor form
description: Yashasvi Jaiswal revealed that the Indian dressing room feels unsettled when Rohit Sharma doesn't scold younger players, as his reprimands are always affectionate. Jaiswal highlighted the inspirational presence of Rohit and Virat Kohli, who share valuable experiences and guidance. He also expressed his ambition to lead India one day.

title: IPL: Punjab Kings' auction preview – Iyer’s settled side enter with few gaps to fill
description: Punjab Kings, IPL 2025 runners-up, enter the 2026 auction with a settled squad and Rs 11.50 crore purse. They aim to fill gaps in wicket-keeping and spin bowling, potentially targeting overseas keeper-batters like Jonny Bairstow or Tim Seifert, and spin all-rounders to bolster their title aspirations.

title: Bombay HC questions police role in ₹300-Crore Pune land deal, asks if it is shielding Ajit Pawar’s son
description: The Bombay High Court questioned if the police is shielding Deputy CM Ajit Pawar’s son in the ₹300-Crore land deal; businesswoman withdraws anticipatory bail plea after court shows disinclination.

title: City’s reservoirs near full as inflow continues; WRD maintains marginal release
description: Reservoirs in Poondi and Red Hills reached capacity while the one in Chembarambakkam may reach capacity by Thursday; it would ensure normal drinking water supply to city for another year

title: Citing federalism and rights of states, Sibal opposes simultaneous elections
Home minister did not answer my questions: Rahul Gandhi
description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticized Home Minister Amit Shah's response on electoral reforms as "defensive," asserting that key opposition questions went unanswered. Gandhi highlighted concerns regarding transparent voter lists, EVM architecture, and alleged dual voting by BJP functionaries, noting Shah's silence on these points and the removal of the Chief Justice from the EC selection collegium.

title: Congress walks out after Nirbhaya Fund question withdrawn in RS
Don’t offer employment to unfamiliar people: CM Himanta to Assam residents
Reopen Nathu La border trade, vital for livelihood: BJP MP
New Zealand lose Tickner as West Indies all out for 205
description: Tickner was the pick of the New Zealand bowlers, taking 4-32 from 16 overs, but his day ended prematurely when he tumbled onto his shoulder while fielding and left on a stretcher

title: Ballot papers will bring back booth capturing: BJP
description: BJP leaders Ravi Shankar Prasad and Kangana Ranaut strongly defended Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) in Lok Sabha, dismissing calls to return to ballot papers as a move backward to booth capturing. They highlighted court validations for EVMs and the Election Commission's challenge for parties to hack them. Ranaut criticized the opposition's defeatist attitude and disruptive parliamentary behavior.

title: Congress claims EC is partisan, points to immunity given in 2023 for its actions
description: Opposition leaders slammed the Election Commission, calling it "compromised" and accusing the BJP of "vote chori." Congress MP K C Venugopal highlighted the freezing of party bank accounts and the EC's inaction on PM Modi's alleged poll code violations.

title: Congress brass behind poll defeats, not EVMs: Amit Shah
description: Home Minister Amit Shah strongly refuted opposition claims of "vote chori," attributing Congress's defeats to leadership failures. He defended electoral roll revisions and challenged allegations of institutional capture by the RSS. Shah highlighted past instances of alleged vote manipulation by Congress leaders and accused the opposition of opposing national interests.

title: 'Very positive': Italian Deputy PM Tajani on meeting with PM Modi
description: During the meeting, the two leaders discussed deepening industrial collaboration and cultural exchanges while underlining India's key role in facilitating dialogue between Russia and Ukraine to achieve a peaceful resolution

title: US expands vetting of social media to H-1B applicants, dependents
Didn't engineer chaos to bypass pilot rest rules: IndiGo chairman
description: IndiGo's chairman, Vikram Singh Mehta, apologized for recent flight disruptions, denying they were deliberate. He stated external experts will identify root causes to prevent future chaos. Mehta clarified that the airline followed new pilot rest rules and did not compromise safety. A combination of internal and external factors, not intentional actions, pushed systems beyond limits, causing cancellations.

title: If ‘pilot suicide’ theory holds water, why data taken to US for analysis: Attorney
Gujarat SIR: 99.99% of counting phase completed, 27 districts achieve 100%
Delhi HC: Why did you let crisis precipitate? Failure on part of govt, DGCA
description: The Delhi High Court delivered a sharp critique to the Union government, condemning its complacency as IndiGo's flight cancellations wreaked havoc on travel plans and sent prices soaring. The bench voiced concerns over why no preventive measures were taken as the situation deteriorated, placing travelers in precarious positions while calling for reparations.

title: Amit Shah links vote chori to Nehru, Indira, Sonia; says Congress loss its leadership’s doing

7-10 yrs jail, collective punishment: Karnataka tables hate speech Bill
Farmers clash with police during protest against ethanol factory in Rajasthan
description: The agitating farmers entered the factory compound and ransacked the building materials used for construction. The crowd, which turned restive after the lathicharge, torched about 10 vehicles and damaged three bulldozers.

title: President Murmu stresses human rights for all, including 'person in last mile'
description: President Murmu emphasized ensuring human rights for everyone, highlighting India's shift from entitlement to empowerment and charity to rights over the past decade. She noted government efforts to provide essential services like clean water, electricity, and healthcare, securing dignity for all households.

title: US trade representative says India's offer 'best-ever received' as both teams huddle
description: US trade representative Jamieson Greer highlighted India's "best-ever" offers in ongoing trade talks, calling the nation a "tough nut to crack" due to resistance on certain agricultural imports.  Senior US officials are in New Delhi to advance negotiations for a mutually beneficial trade agreement, with India now seen as a "viable alternative market" for US commodities.

title: Fifty years ago | Nepal decrees price cuts of 10 to 30 per cent
At 1.2L, 70% of 2024 road deaths were because of speeding: Govt
description: Speeding remains the primary killer on Indian roads, responsible for nearly 70% of the 1.2 lakh road deaths in 2024. Non-usage of helmets and seatbelts also contributed significantly to fatalities. Despite some dips, these dangerous behaviors continue to pose a major challenge to road safety across the nation.

title: A hundred years ago | Production of raw silk in the empire
Speedy justice? Tribunals have 5L pending cases
description: Specialised tribunals, designed for swift justice, are overwhelmed by over 5.24 lakh pending cases, primarily due to significant member vacancies.  Debt Recovery Tribunals lead with 2.5 lakh cases.  Seven tribunals lack chairpersons, and 18% of member posts are unfilled, hindering efficient case resolution despite government efforts and technological adoption.

title: 'Direct path to citizenship': Trump launches Gold Card, cites corporate demand — what it means
description: US President Donald Trump has launched the 'Trump Gold Card,' a new immigration initiative offering a direct path to citizenship for qualified individuals. This program aims to retain invaluable talent for American companies, with applicants potentially contributing billions to the US Treasury. Earlier proposals indicated significant financial contributions for this expedited residency pathway.

title: PBKMS issues contempt notice to Centre, Bengal govt over delayed resumption of MGNREGA
description: Chief Minister Mamata  Banerjee on Tuesday said that the conditions imposed by the Union government on the 100-day work scheme was humiliating for the State government and publicly tore up a note from the Union government in this regard.

title: Kournikova vs Iglesias net worth 2025: Tennis star and music icon compared
description: Anna Kournikova and Enrique Iglesias boast a combined net worth of approximately $160 million in 2025. Kournikova's wealth stems primarily from lucrative brand deals and modeling, while Iglesias' fortune is built on hit songs, extensive tours, and strategic business ventures. The couple maintains a private life in Miami with their children.

title: After Goa nightclub fire: Capital to soon permit third party audit for fire licence, says CM
Isro to launch its heaviest US commercial sat BlueBird-6 on December 15
description: India's ISRO is set to launch its heaviest American commercial satellite, the 6.5-tonne BlueBird-6, on December 15 from Sriharikota. This marks a significant boost to Indo-US space cooperation. The LVM3 rocket will carry the satellite, designed to provide direct-to-device mobile broadband in areas with poor network coverage, aiming to bridge the digital divide.

title: Is Devin Booker playing tonight vs Thunder? Latest injury update on Suns star
description: The Phoenix Suns face the Oklahoma City Thunder in an NBA Cup quarterfinal with star guard Devin Booker's status uncertain due to a right groin strain.  Booker's potential absence adds significant tension as the Suns, seeking consistency, confront the league-leading Thunder.  Phoenix also contends with injuries to Jalen Green and Isaiah Livers.

title: ‘Uncollectable’ forms of ineligible voters in West Bengal crosses 57.5 lakhs, dead voters over 24 lakhs
description: In a final push before the enumeration phase of SIR is slated to end on December 11, 2025, the West Bengal CEO directs Special Roll Observers to thoroughly scrutinise entries and data before the enumeration phase ends on December 11

title: Two buildings collapse in Moroccan city of Fez, killing 22 people
description: It was unclear what caused the collapse or how many people were unaccounted for. Authorities said an investigation has been opened.

title: Trump says the U.S. has seized an oil tanker off Venezuela
description: We've just seized a tanker on the coast of Venezuela — a large tanker, very large, the largest one ever seized, actually, says U.S. President Donald Trump

description: Govt. fully committed to ensuring robust fire-safety standards in Capital, says Sood; DFS personnel asked to check compliance in wake of Goa tragedy and given the ‘increased risk associated with upcoming festive season’

title: SIR and the annihilation of rights
description: What is eerily similar in the technocratic adventures in MGNREGA and the SIR is the structural codification of exclusions

title: Winds of change in music
description: Changes have caught up with the sabhas in Chennai in many ways

title: Odisha Assembly clears Bill to implement threefold hike in salary, pension for MLAs
description: Under the revised pay structure, a legislator will draw ₹3.45 lakh per month against ₹1.10 lakh in 2007

title: Sovereign control a valid concern: Satya Nadella
description: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella announced a significant $17.5 billion investment in India over four years, focusing on AI and cloud. He acknowledged India's need for sovereign control and local resilience in technology deployment. Nadella lauded India's unique "virtuous cycle" of policies, digital infrastructure, and market, highlighting the launch of Sovereign Public Cloud for enhanced governance and control.

title: If we can beat India we are good enough to win the World Cup, says coach Nawaz
description: The former Sri Lankan player guided Bangladesh to the 2020 U-19 World Cup title and the Asia Cup last year, beating India in the final on both occasions

title: EC extends deadline for booth rearrangement in West Bengal
Power of contempt is not a sword to silence critics: Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court has overturned a Bombay High Court order sentencing a woman to jail for contempt. Justices Vikram Nath and Sandeep Mehta emphasized that mercy and forgiveness are crucial judicial principles. They stated that sincere remorse and an apology, even if qualified, should be accepted, particularly when a contemnor acknowledges their mistake and seeks atonement.

title: Woman killed after tractor hits scooter in Karawal Nagar
CM celebrates Deepavali’s inclusion in UNESCO heritage list

Market engulfed in flames in Russia's St Petersburg; several explosions heard - video
description: A devastating fire has engulfed one of St. Petersburg's major markets, with reports of explosions. The blaze, which broke out Wednesday night in the Nevsky district, has tragically claimed one life and injured two others. Thick smoke billowed over the city as the entire market complex is believed to be consumed by flames.

title: IndiGo chairman denies claims that airline engineered crisis; says board was engaged on FDTL rules for ‘many months’

title: Thunder vs Suns injury update: Who’s in, who’s out, and how to watch
description: The Oklahoma City Thunder, with a dominant 23-1 record, are set to host the Phoenix Suns in the NBA Cup quarterfinals. The reigning champions have won 15 straight games, while the Suns, on a 14-10 run, face an uphill battle, especially with Devin Booker questionable due to a groin injury.

Over 75,000 polling stations in T.N. after rationalisation process
UK report says Indian-origin parents may be aborting female foetuses
description: UK government analysis reveals a significant imbalance in birth sex ratios among Indian-origin families, with 113 males per 100 females for third or subsequent births. This anomaly suggests potential sex-selective abortions, with an estimated 400 such cases occurring in England and Wales between 2017 and 2021. Officials state sex-selective abortion is illegal and will not be tolerated.

title: Two student advisers to Bangladesh’s interim government resign ahead of poll schedule announcement
description: Mr. Bhuiyan was the adviser in charge of the Ministry of Youth and Sports as well as the Ministry of Local Government, Rural Development and Cooperatives, while Mahfuj Alam served as adviser to the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting.

The 29-year-old tourist allegedly violated visa norms by traveling to restricted areas after arriving on a visa permitting only specific Buddhist pilgrimage sites. He was questioned for several days before his return.

Alvin Kamara injury update: Saints share cryptic message on RB’s status
description: Star running back Alvin Kamara's availability for the New Orleans Saints' Sunday game against the Panthers remains uncertain due to a knee and ankle injury. Coach Kellen Moore offered a cryptic "We'll see" regarding his return. Kamara, who missed the last two games, is focused on recovery and expressed a desire to retire with the team, despite past trade rumors.

description: Owners of a Goa nightclub where 25 died in a fire sought transit anticipatory bail in Delhi, claiming they were on "official work" in Thailand. Goa police objected, stating the brothers booked flights after the blaze began. Interpol has issued a blue corner notice against them.

title: Top leaders to cast votes in Kannur as local body polls begin on Dec. 11

description: Leader of the Opposition demands sacking of ministers who failed to hold periodic reviews on implementation of developmental projects in North Karnataka region

description: The latest announcement on vetting social media activities has added another layer to the grant of H1-B visa seekers that is expected to prolong the waiting time for fresh applicants

description: LDF will benefit from having the upper hand from the very outset in seat-sharing, finalising candidates, and later in campaigning as a united force, says CPI district secretary

description: Each tray can support up to nine plants and features a fully self-contained nutrient reservoir that allows continuous nutrient circulation without external tanks or complex plumbing

description: The Federal Reserve's FOMC reduced its key interest rate by 25 basis points, bringing it to a near three-year low. This move aims to bolster the US economy amidst deteriorating employment conditions, though concerns about inflation persist due to trade tariffs.

SIA attaches Pakistan-based Hizbul terrorist’s property in J&K’s Doda
description: Jammu and Kashmir Police's State Investigation Agency (SIA) attached the property of Zahid Hussain, a Pakistan-based Hizbul Mujahideen commander, in Doda district. Hussain, who illegally crossed to Pakistan in 2000, was involved in radicalizing and recruiting youth via social media. This action is part of a broader crackdown to dismantle the terror ecosystem in the Union Territory.

description: Scrub typhus is an infection caused by the bacterium Orientia tsutsugamushi and is transmitted to humans through the bite of infected larval mites, commonly known as chiggers

title: Video: Massive fire breaks out at Nevsky Market in Russia’s Saint Petersburg
Watch: Amit Shah targets opposition on SIR in Lok Sabha
description: Home Minister Amit Shah delivered a rebuttal in Parliament, defending the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls and accusing the Opposition of spreading misinformation. He emphasised that the Election Commission alone is empowered to conduct roll revisions, reiterated that foreign nationals cannot remain on voter lists, criticised alleged double standards by Opposition parties, and cited historical precedents to counter “vote theft” allegations.

title: India gives tepid response to Russian push for Su-57, long-range drones and submarines
description: Rajnath Singh highlighted that India, once heavily dependent on arms imports, now boasts a record defence production value of ₹1.51 lakh crore, up from ₹46,000 crore in 2014

title: FIH Junior World Cup: Germany have another world-class goalkeeper on their hands as they win record-extending 8th title
Goa nightclub fire: MEA considering Goa govt's request to revoke passports of co-owners
description: A Delhi court refused to give any interim protection from arrest to the duo, while their partner was held in connection with the fire incident

title: Lack of coercive action, Supreme Court order saw end-of-life vehicles still ply capital roads: CAQM tells top court
description: The CAQM, represented by Additional Solicitor General Aishwarya Bhati, submitted that its efforts to strictly ensure that these end-of-life vehicles were taken off the roads were thwarted by the lack of proper coercive action; over 63 lakh such vehicles are currently plying the capital’s roads and contributing to air pollution, says the body

title: Kidwai study flags high burden of colorectal cancer among Indians below 45
description: According to ICMR, colorectal cancer accounts for 7% - 8% of all cancer cases in India, with over 70,000 new cases annually

title: CM Revanth Reddy allocates ₹1,000 crore for Osmania University’s global makeover
description: Delivers promise from the iconic Arts College, invoking Komuram Bheem’s fight for Adivasi dignity, the armed peasant struggle against feudal exploitation and Telangana movement

title: There can only be one goal in the Candidates: to play for first place, says Bluebaum
description: The 28-year-old player will be the first German to feature in the prestigious event since 1991; feels that keeping his nerves under control was key to the good show in the Grand Swiss; says it is great to see the huge interest for chess in India

title: No more ‘woke’ Calibri font, Marco Rubio orders all US diplomatic correspondence in Times New Roman
Alok Kumar elevated to DGP rank, to head Prisons department from December 12
5 cops on poll duty injured in road crash
Daughter of Venezuela's Machado picks up Nobel peace prize in her absence
description: In a call with the chair of the Nobel Committee, Jorgen Watne Frydnes, published just before the ceremony, Maria Corina Machado said she was “very sad and very sorry” that she would not make it in time but was on her way to Oslo

title: British Indian nurse jailed for rape, sexual assaults at Scotland care home
description: “In addition to the serious and predatory nature of your offending, notwithstanding the fact you pled guilty, the version of events given by you bears little resemblance to what you have admitted to,” says Justice Lord Renucci

title: Richard Rapport praises ‘safety net’ that has helped India’s chess stars rise meteorically
Modi govt maligning the entire leadership of the national movement: Congress
description: In its pursuit of defaming the first Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru, the Narendra Modi Government was maligning the entire leadership of the national movement, including Rabindranath Tagore and Mahatma Gandhi, says Opposition in a united voice

3,097 polling stations set up in Kozhikode
description: Officials on election duty collected polling materials, including electronic voting machines, from 20 distribution centres and reached their respective stations by Dec. 10 evening. The electorate stands at 26,82,682, with 6,328 candidates in the fray

title: IND vs SA | ‘Even at 11, he would hit sixes’: Abhishek Sharma’s father, coaches talk about India’s great hitting talent
Philip Rivers’ week 15 status takes center stage as Colts turn to veteran QB after Daniel Jones’ injury
description: Indianapolis has brought back 44-year-old Philip Rivers from retirement to address quarterback instability after Daniel Jones' season-ending injury. Rivers, who previously led the Colts to the playoffs, has signed to the practice squad and is being evaluated for a potential Week 15 start against Seattle. His familiarity with the system and proven leadership could reignite their playoff hopes.

Goa club fire: Net closes in on Luthra brothers; MEA may revoke passports
description: Goa government seeks passport revocation for Gaurav and Saurabh Luthra, believed to be in Thailand, following a deadly nightclub blaze. The brothers, who allegedly fled India hours after the fire, have sought transit anticipatory bail, claiming they left for work and intend to return.

Sophie Kinsella passes away at 55: A look at the author’s life & books
description: Beloved author Sophie Kinsella, pen name of Madeleine Sophie Wickham, has passed away at 55 after a battle with glioblastoma. Known for her warm, humorous, and relatable storytelling, Kinsella's novels, including the "Shopaholic" series, brought laughter and optimism to millions. Her legacy of resilience and joy continues to inspire readers worldwide.

description: Goa nightclub proprietors Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra whisked themselves away to Phuket mere hours after a catastrophic fire claimed 25 lives. This abrupt exodus has raised eyebrows among law enforcement, who view it as an attempt to dodge accountability.

description: India's star batter Smriti Mandhana revealed her deep passion for cricket, stating nothing matters more than the sport and wearing the national jersey. Reflecting on the World Cup win, she described it as the culmination of years of hard work and disappointment, a victory for all who paved the way.

UPSC Case Study : What if you were a security official in a Left-Wing Extremism (LWE) area?
Ally or adversary? Why 2026 Bangladesh polls are critical for India - explained
description: Bangladesh's February 2026 election is pivotal for India's regional security following Sheikh Hasina's ouster. The ban on the Awami League creates a vacuum, potentially empowering parties critical of India. This shift demands a rapid re-evaluation of New Delhi's policy towards its crucial eastern neighbour, impacting connectivity, trade, and counter-insurgency efforts.

title: Govinda’s wife Sunita recalls when their 3-month-old daughter died in her arms: ‘Extremely difficult for me, her lungs didn’t develop’

Alyssa Healy on England: ‘Ben Stokes shoulders too much responsibility’
Jasprit Bumrah-Arshdeep Singh axis: India’s golden geese for T20 World Cup
Jamie Dimon poaches Buffett's investor: Jeff Bezos, Dell join; $1.5T at stake
description: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon has formed a high-profile advisory council, including tech titans and defense leaders, to guide a massive $1.5 trillion national security spending plan. The initiative aims to bolster American self-reliance by investing in critical technologies and reducing dependence on foreign suppliers, particularly China.  A new $10 billion fund will back companies in advanced chips and AI.

title: F&O frenzy: NSE's 15-minute tweak that could save billions for traders - explained
description: The National Stock Exchange has introduced a 15-minute pre-open session for equity derivatives, a significant structural change aimed at enhancing stability and transparency. This move follows concerns over retail trader losses and volatility in India's hyperactive derivatives market, with the goal of improving price discovery and preventing erratic trades.

title: Caught in SIR storm: BLOs fight fatigue & fear amid crushing deadlines; a look into their daily grind
description: Booth Level Officers (BLOs) in West Bengal are facing immense pressure and exhaustion during the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls. Working 12-16 hour days, they are struggling with tight deadlines, demanding tasks, and fear of consequences, blurring the lines between work and personal life. Political parties blame each other for the strain.

title: Next CIC: Rahul raises dissent; holds nearly 90-minute meet with PM Modi, Shah
description: Rahul Gandhi met PM Modi and Amit Shah to finalise key appointments for the Central Information Commission and Central Vigilance Commission, submitting a dissent note. This meeting occurred as Gandhi's upcoming Berlin visit for an Indian Overseas Congress event drew criticism from the BJP, accusing him of prioritizing foreign trips over parliamentary duties.

title: IndiGo crisis: DGCA deploys oversight team at airline's HQ; flight ops under lens
description: In response to recent flight disruptions that have left many passengers stranded, the Civil Aviation Ministry has established a specialized oversight team to oversee IndiGo's operations. This proactive step aims to mitigate the inconvenience caused by extensive delays and cancellations.

title: What Tesla CEO Elon Musk said when asked: If he believes in God
description: Elon Musk shared his thoughts on faith, calling the Creator the funniest person he knows. He also spoke about the Department of Government Efficiency's partial success. Musk detailed SpaceX's Starship, highlighting its role in making humanity multi-planetary. This technology ensures planetary redundancy for survival.

title: Mutual Fund advisor: Choosing the right fund; a 5-step shortcut that works
description: Forget quick tips; a decade-long investment requires a structured approach. The article outlines a five-step checklist, starting with fund category based on goals and risk tolerance. It emphasizes long-term track records, consistent performance, behavior during market downturns, and finally, costs and fund hygiene.

title: H-1b visas: US Embassy's advisory to applicants - 'Will not be allowed inside if'
description: US Embassy India has issued a crucial advisory for visa applicants, warning that attending a previously scheduled appointment after receiving a rescheduling notice will lead to denied entry. This comes as H-1B visa interviews are being postponed due to new social media vetting rules, potentially delaying foreign workers' return to the US for months.

title: Cardi B’s Art Basel look goes viral as Stefon Diggs’ comments steal spotlight
description: Stefon Diggs' heartfelt and humorous comments on Cardi B's Art Basel photos stole the show, overshadowing her new furniture line. His touching "Your love supports me" and playful "Don't expose our jokes" revealed a rare, intimate glimpse into their relationship, turning a fashion post into a viral sensation and sparking widespread fan engagement.

title: Brittany Mahomes goes silent after Mahomes–Kelce meltdown rocks Chiefs
description: Kansas City Chiefs faced a tough loss against the Houston Texans. Quarterback Patrick Mahomes and player Travis Kelce struggled on the field. Brittany Mahomes, wife of Patrick Mahomes, remained silent on social media after the game. This quiet response mirrored the disappointment felt by many fans. The team's playoff hopes are now uncertain.

title: Ayesha Curry on women pursuing Steph: “I’ve wanted to punch them”
description: Ayesha Curry revealed on 'Red Table Talk' that she sometimes feels the urge to confront women who approach her husband, Stephen Curry, due to his naturally friendly demeanor. She later expressed regret about her appearance on the show, attributing the backlash to the platform's chaotic nature and the misinterpretation of her words.
